Enumeration Type Documentation

enum cli::KEY

Input characters.

Enumerator:
NULL_KEY  Null key.
BREAK  Break (Ctrl+C).
LOGOUT  Logout (Ctrl+D).
ENTER  Enter.
ESCAPE  Escape.
SPACE  Space.
BACKSPACE  Backspace.
KEY_UP  Up arrow key.
KEY_DOWN  Down arrow key.
KEY_LEFT  Left arrow key.
KEY_RIGHT  Right arrow key.
PAGE_UP  Page up arrow key.
PAGE_DOWN  Page down arrow key.

enum cli::STREAM_TYPE

Output stream enumeration.

Enumerator:
ALL_STREAMS  All streams.
WELCOME_STREAM  Welcome stream. Useful for bye too.
PROMPT_STREAM  Prompt stream.
ECHO_STREAM  Echo stream.
OUTPUT_STREAM  Output stream.
ERROR_STREAM  Error stream.
STREAM_TYPES_COUNT  Number of streams.

Definition at line 46 of file shell.h.

Function Documentation

void cli::EnsureCommonDevices ( void   ) 

Ensures common input / output devices creation.

This method is basically called in constructors of objects that may need common devices all along their validity, even in their constructors.

void cli::EnsureTraces ( void   ) 

Ensures the trace object creation.

This method is basically called in constructors of objects that may generate traces all along their validity, even in their destructor.

Variable Documentation

const IOEndl cli::endl

The common IOEndl object. endl can be passed to OutputDevice to print carriage returns.

It is better to use endl rather to print "\n" or "\r\n" since this should depend on the OutputDevice.

Definition at line 30 of file io_device.cpp.
